snippet: The doctrine of Jeroen Dijsselbloem, the head of the Eurogroup, could mean that bondholders end up absorbing steep losses if euro zone members are called upon to prop up failing banks.
abstract: Jeroen Dijsselbloem, newly elected head of the Eurogroup consortium of finance ministers, is gaining reputation as a strict disciplinarian who means to shift burden of bailouts from taxpayers to investors; his doctrine could mean that bondholders of failing banks may end up absorbing steep losses if euro zone members are called upon to prop up the institutions.
lead_paragraph: The doctrine of Jeroen Dijsselbloem, the head of the Eurogroup, could mean that bondholders end up absorbing steep losses if euro zone members are called upon to prop up failing banks.

headline.main: In New Euro Boss, a Hard-Line Future
headline.print_headline: Chief Takes Harder Line On Banks In Europe
